intro: Chenopodium × subhastatum f. liguiforme, commonly known as the slender goosefoot, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in dense clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. It is native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its adaptability and ornamental potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
